User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b10pre) Gecko/20110118 Firefox/4.0b10pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:2.0b10pre) Gecko/20110118 Firefox/4.0b10pre

The Back/Forward buttons seem to be erroneously disabled if you have navigated prior to adding them to the toolbar. This happens with both the Back and Forward buttons.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start Firefox with a fresh profile.
2. Navigate to http://www.mozilla.org
3. Right-click the chrome near the tabs and click Customize.
4. Drag the Back/Forward buttons into the Customize Toolbar window.
5. Click Done.
6. Click on a link on the Mozilla home page.
7. Right-click the chrome near the tabs and click Customize.
8. Drag the Back/Forward buttons back onto the chrome next to the address bar.
9. Notice that the Back button is disabled.
Actual Results:  
The Back button is disabled even though there is a page to go back to.

Expected Results:  
The Back button should be enabled.

This has been tested with a fresh profile with no extensions installed.

Modifying Steps to Reproduce by adding "Right-click and select 'Back'" between steps 6 and 7 in order to reproduce the same behavior for the Forward button.
